Reviews.Title: S9700? Consider buying the Extended Warranty!
Reviews.Author: R. Boss
Reviews.Content: Update: Oh No, 5 days left on the Amazon return window and I got a "Lens Error" message on my screen.  Could I be on camera #3 in one month?First week of ownership; I'm on camera #2.  The flash on my first camera "needed help" to pop-up (Nikon Service confirmed this was not normal).  Thanks Amazon for the fast replacement!600 pictures on both cameras (300 each) and I'm very happy with its performance.  My reference point for "performance" means reliable, crisp, focused picture(s) on a consistent basis (ie. not blurry) while in maximum resolution, minimal zoom, usually during a rushed "point and shoot" scenario.  This is my 3rd Nikon (S8000; $200 and S3300; $100).  The S9700 is an upward progression from the S8000 (I was very happy with), whereas I'll use my smartphone to take pictures before I ever drop $100 for an entry level camera (S3300) again.PRO's (in order of my needs)Easy viewing monitor in bright daylight (except with polarized sunglasses for horizontal/landscape pictures; vertical/portrait OK)High Resolution (MegaPixels) at $300 price pointFast focus to get all 9 "focus boxes" to appear for a crisp pictureMacro pictures are great as long as you don't need the flash (lens shadow)Non-detachable lens (pro/con) - many venues I attend specify no "professional photography" ie. camera's with a detachable lens.WiFi is convenient to download photo's to your smartphone (to email/text) as well as use as a camera remote control with zoom (instead of just the self timer)Fast transfer of photo's out of the camera via its usb port- Natural progression from the S8000- Ton's of manual manipulation options (compared to S8000)- Takes the same battery as the S8000, so I can share the batteries between the 2 cameras.Con's- That flash is going to break (again), it's a matter of "when".  It's made of plastic and has more pivot points than a bi-fold door (see my pictures).- $6 Nikon Extended Service Coverage (ESC) Nikon 2-Year Extended Service Coverage (ESC) for Nikon Coolpix Digital Cameras I consider this a must if you plan to own your camera beyond 1 year.  Nikon stopped selling service parts to independent dealers.  I had a great experience with Nikon service (repair of my S8000) and feel it worth the investment.Recommendation?  If you have a S8000 and looking to upgrade, then this would be a good camera for you.  1. You have the experience to keep your fingers out of the way of flash.  2. You already know the PCB (circuit board) inside will break at 2 years so you know you need that ESC.  3. The new controls/options will open a new world of photography to you without diving into the d-SLR world (not a substitute to the d-SLR world by any means).I wouldn't recommend this to someone new to digital cameras, or new to Nikon.  It's not an entry level camera.  I get the feeling that most people have no idea how to get the 9 green focus boxes, or what they mean.  I've learned to not hand my camera to someone else expecting a good picture.I have never owned a digital camera that didn't break.  That's why with my S8000, I bought the ESC for $2.  Canon (repaired within warranty), Olympus (repaired within warranty), Nikon (returned S3300, and S8000 repaired in extended warranty).I'm not thrilled with the S9700 flash mechanism, but all it's competitor's (DSC-RX100, XZ-2, PowerShot SX600) seem to have gone the same direction.  Time will tell.For what it's worth, if you like soft neoprene cases, I do recommend the FlexArmor case FlexARMOR Compact Digital Camera Case with Carrying Carabiner for Sony Cyber-shot DSC-RX100 II , HX200V , DSC-HX50V , DSC-WX50 and Many More Sony Point and Shoot Digital Cameras.  It holds the camera, 1 extra battery and extra SD cards perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Compact beauty
Reviews.Author: Omnium Nihil
Reviews.Content: I was able to take a stable electronic zoom at 1500 mm in bright sunlight. Most impressive. I had been considering a bridge or full DSLR before I select this. The aperture /shutter priority with full manual control is impressive and works very well. I have yet to use much of the special settings as the traditional control is so good. I do regret that the aperture cannot be stopped down to a1.8 much less1.4, but this is my travel camera and it will likely be with me where a bulky DSLR wouldn't (I know, because even  before film became scarce I rarely took my canon AE1P and associated lenses but often took my canon SD550 and before that a Chinon digital compact and before that a Minolta film compact). One problem was trying to connect to my iDevices by Wi-Fi. Nikon service couldn't fix it. However, I found that by sending an internet message from the iDevice to the camera in the http://xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx format while the camera was searching for a connection and then clicking on the "take photos" button in the Nikon app fixed the problem. The camera URL (xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx in which they x's are replaced by the appropriate numbers) is listed in one of the sub menus. One big concerns was whether the OLED screen would be bright enough to see on a sunny Louisiana day. It's not perfect, but way better than an iDevice and almost the same quality as a kindle paper white but with colors bleached out to almost match the paper white with no dark letters/scene specifics. The wide angle to zoom is fantastic. I also find that  as long as I am aware of the flash settings, it's location is not a problem. However, the flash seems to want to pop up whenever I try to place the camera in its case or just touch the camera "wrong". The flash is thus way too sensitive. The battery compartment cover has been modified from earlier models and is very secure now. I did find out that using my iPhone to take pictures above the crowd at the concert and taking about a ten minute movie really depleted the battery.  ( I used three batteries for just185 pictures and the movie, but I was really going wild with the Wi-Fi ).  I fully expect 300 or so pictures can be taken per battery if the camera is used as a regular camera, just haven't tried that yet. Also using the phone to take pictures through the camera necessitated a lengthy wait while the photo downloaded. Overall though,  a very good product.

Reviews.Title: 1st week review
Reviews.Author: Joe Fackelman
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this past week. I'm pleased to say that I'm not disappointed. I will say that I had a little bit of challenge figuring out the WIFI part. However, the trick that I found is to open the smartphone app after you turn on the WIFI settings on your phone, and selecting "connect to smart device" on the camera. Pics transferred VERY quickly.I really like how fast the camera is at starting up. That's a big feature in my opinion. Many potential shots can be lost while waiting for the camera to turn on.The only thing I wish I could find or have is an external polarizer filter when shooting outdoors during the day. I know you can touch up photos via computer/photo editing apps. Just like to do it in real time.

Reviews.Title: great pictures
Reviews.Author: C. Edmunds Rhoad
Reviews.Content: I bought it on line so I was a little taken back by its size.  I was looking for a pocket camera.  With that said, it is just fine.  The pictures are outstanding and superior to a pocket camera.  I bought it for the GPS and WiFi capabilities.  GPS is very good, but it drains the battery so a second battery of back up is a necessity.  The WiFi is disappointing as it only transfers pictures to my iPhone and not to my iPad.  In addition it requires its own free software to do so.  So it is a two step process to get the photos into iPhoto, and then it transfers them to Photo Stream and not to Camera Roll.I have a little concern with the pop up flash and the lens cover so I use a camera bag and do not put it in my pocket unprotectedThey say that the best camera is the one in your pocket so that is my iPhone.  However, the best one for quality, especially low light quality it this camera.  Great pictures, I recommend this camera and would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing overall due to small sensor and high megapixel noise in images
Reviews.Author: Brad Hutchinson
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a possible replacement for a Panasonic ZS25 along with an Olympus SH-1.  I ended up returning this camera.This camera started going downhill the second I turned it on.  There was an obvious speck of dust/dirt on the CCD sensor straight out of the box that was noticeable in every picture with a solid background.  This is a problem I have had with all the Panasonic travel zooms over the years but none of them were dusty straight out of the box like this Nikon.  I can only imagine how much dust will be on the sensor once this camera is used outdoors and would not trust this camera even if it had been excellent in all other ways.Price - Paid $319.  Price is decent considering it offers GPS, Wi-Fi, and a 30X optical zoom.Ergonomics - Somewhat heavy (233 grams/8.2 ounces including battery) and large for a point and shoot making one handed shooting difficult.  No real grip exists and the camera is slippery.  Has a poorly located pop up flash that is directly under where your left hand sits if doing two handed shooting.Build Quality - Mainly plastic.  When the camera is turned off the lens assembly wobbles around inside the camera with every move.  Dust inside the camera straight out of the box tells me it is not sealed very well.Notable features - Built in GPS and Wi-FiZoom Usability - While this camera has the longest zoom out of the three it is not usable to 30X.  Even in bright daylight the flash will deploy if zoomed in to 30X and photos come out dark.  Zoom gauge is confusing since no X number is shown (ie 20X, 24x).  Hand held shots are possible at full zoom but I recommend burst mode because most will be blurry.Image Quality -A. Daytime images are inconsistent; some are excellent others are horrible.B. Low light images have lots of noise.C. The flash is bright and night images look very good.D. The macro mode takes good close up pictures with nice detail.E. Has the best autofocus of the three with numerous areas of focus showing up on the LCD screen.Overall some images come out looking really good and others are very noisy.  The 30X zoom is unusable because the f/ is too dark.  Night images with flash are great but the Panasonic ZS15 remains my favorite compact travel zoom.

Reviews.Title: Gets ZERO out of TEN for Point-n-shoot capability
Reviews.Author: Gagan
Reviews.Content: Edited on 18th may:I had to return the camera as on 15th day (last day to return), the LCD screen stopped working. What a bummer... I really liked 30x zoom.Original comment below.........I have a D-SLR with telescopic lense but wanted to replace my compact camera. I was impessed by this little compact camera with 30x zoom and features. I took it to a trip to Hawaii and here is my review after extensive use (over 200 pictures)...The good:-Compact and 30x zoom that works very well (use tripod)-awesome features that allow many ways to tone brightness, color, background exposure, depth blah blah-excellent video HD qualitythe Bad-You adjust focus and get ready to shoot... just as you click you will notice the subject gets hazy and you get a horrible picture. Two weeks later i am still to figure why.-Poor grip (zoom lense and flash make it hard to grip)-Flash seems tacky and i am not sure how long it will last-This camera gets 0 out of 10 for "point and shoot capability".-The picture quality is extremely bad unless you are in perfect condition. To get good quality picture, you can spin dials but that is where it is your interpretation of 'photo quality'... it is not natural. Fr instance, Tiki torches look too orange and ocean looks too blue.So this is not a point and shoot camera, I am very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Pop up flash is noisy, jarring and surprising
Reviews.Author: Sandra S. Unger "Camcorder Novice"
Reviews.Content: The pop up flash is wretched, noisy, and worst of all the default is set to flash AUTO.  I see no way to set the default flash to OFF.  Every time I turn the camera off and back on, it defaults to flash AUTO.  If there is no way to change the default to flash OFF, this camera goes back.  The flash is also exactly where your finger wants to go for a nice grip of the camera. Nice camera, REALLY WRETCHED pop up flash. The pop up flash froze in place several times, apparently due to placing a finger on the pop up flash opening.  Very frustrated with what could have been a fantastic camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: P. C. Knedler "PCK"
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I wanted a super zoom camera.  I like the features such as selective color, where one color is highlighted against black and white.  I took some pictures at a soccer game and was really impressed with the clarity and detail in the pictures, even from a long distance.  Also the size and weight are a plus.  I would recommend this camera as a really nice point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Absolute garbage. Ruining my honeymoon pics
Reviews.Author: chaiguzzler
Reviews.Content: Bought this new to take on a one month trip to Europe, and while not even a month old with gentle handling, multiple things are malfunctioning with this camera such as when starting, the lens extends and the motor wont shut off, creating a loud ratchet noise. The only way to shut it off is to take out the battery. THEN it also quit charging, or holding the charge, not sure which, but when it has the other problems, it's irrelevant. Glad to not have exteneded warranty, because it's too junky to spend one more cent to repair.  This peice of garbage is being returned to buy some other brand. Too bad it's ruining my ability to take pictures for what is a once in a lifetime trip. Nikon has made lifelong enemies with this one.

Reviews.Title: Impressive Zoom but Poor Design
Reviews.Author: Waimun Wong
Reviews.Content: This would have been a great camera except for the poor flash housing design. The zoom is impressive; steady and sharp. The indoor/low light capability make this camera almost perfect for everything. Would have given this camera five stars except for the the flash constantly popping up even when the camera is off. After two months on one week long trip later, I sent the camera back for warranty repairs. Got the camera back today with a note the camera meets factory standards. Well their standards must be sub-par because I don't have much use for a camera with a flash that cant stay closed. Plus with this raised flash design, it will only be a matter of time before the flash gets ripped from the camera. That makes this camera a waste of $350. Anybody want to buy a slightly used but factory standard S9700? Going back to my S8100; that camera has never let me down. Avoid the S9700 unless you want an excuse to buy another camera weeks or months after you break your S9700. I've been a Nikon fan for years (5 Coolpix & 2 SLRs), but I think I'll try Canon's PowerShot SX700 since I really like the 30x zoom.

Reviews.Title: Best Low Light Flash Pictures!!!!
Reviews.Author: Frances B.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an easy to use point and shoot camera with a decent zoom and a camera that would take a good picture in low light! I found all that and more with my new Nikon S9700. The camera test was a bridal shower in a hall without a lot of light. I was thrilled to get bright clear pictures while using the zoom. I appreciate the manual settings when I didn't want to use the auto setting for quicker action shots! Extremely easy to use - very light and slim. I took 250 pictures and the battery was still fully charged. One little issue... the location of the auto pop up flash is poorly designed. The flash should be located in the middle of the camera not in the corner where most people hold their camera. It will take a little getting use to but I will keep the camera because I love the clear pictures - great flash in low light and zoom!

Reviews.Title: fell way short of expectations
Reviews.Author: kathy massullo
Reviews.Content: I went on a 2 week trip and was happy with my canon Powershot but thought to get a camera with more MP and zoom.  I found the camera to be slower in the ability to take more than one picture without a long wait and when shutting it off, it is very slow to close the lens.  If a flash was being used, I had a time remembering to not have my finger on top of the camera.  When done with the flash, I would have to manually close it. I would turn flash off but every time I went to take a picture, it would be back on.  Not good when your in place where flash is not aloud.  Pictures turned out o.k. but nothing spectacular.  I would make picture books after a trip but not bothering with it this time.

Reviews.Title: Excellent P&S; Camera
Reviews.Author: WayneF
Reviews.Content: Have had the camera for 8 days, taken over 300 pictures, a few in just about every mode in the manual.The pictures are Christal clear, sharp and great color.. I took a picture of a light bulb about 50 feet away just to test the zoom. I could read "Made in China" very clearly on the base of bulb.The P&S; cameras I have had before had a lot of shutter lag and was all around slow and frustrating. Not this camera. The manual says 6.9 frames per second for 5 shots and I believe that although I didn't time it.The battery seemed to drain pretty fast, but after reading a article about the GPS feature, I turned that off and now that problem is solved. I just ordered 2 more batteries and a charger in case I want to use that feature later on.I was having a tough time getting my cell phone working with the wireless, but after reading Joe Fackelman's post and doing as he suggested, it came right up. Thank you Joe.Very satisfied with this camera and I won't be lugging my big heavy DSLR camera near as much anymore.Nikon has come up with a excellent, affordable camera with the S9700.

Reviews.Title: Hard to operate
Reviews.Author: David Hamelin
Reviews.Content: I recently waited extra time so I could purchase this camera as soon as it was available. The wait was disappointing. The camera operates very well but the location of the pop up flash more than once surprised me when it pops up and forces you to reframe and take the picture. This has resulted in many shots taken without the flash and losing the moment. Especially bothersome in party settings where a quick reaction is required. The flash is located exactly where you need to hold the camera in order to take a stabile shot. I will be returning it for a different model. I will miss the long zoom but not the frustration of trying to take normal pictures.

Reviews.Title: Not real happy with this camera at this point... (Edit)
Reviews.Author: K. Fengler
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera for almost month and took a lot of pictures in Las Vegas. The last day there I noticed that the focusing was not working and the image in the viewfinder was flickering back and forth. When I tried to take a picture it was blurry.The main reasons I bought this camera was for the WiFi and manual modes. The camera has a lot of bells and whistles but I'm very disappointed in the way it all of a sudden had these malfunctions.I have several NIKON cameras (DSLR w/lens & Point & Shoot) that I'm very happy with. This one I sent in today for warranty and I'll see how that goes. I'll amend this review after I get it back and get to use it for a while.I give it 2 stars because I think overall the camera has great potential, but the one I got in particular has issues. Hoping for the best.06-08-2014 - EDIT: Getting the camera to warranty was painless, easy to do via NIKON's website. So far so good!

Reviews.Title: One very cool, very smart, very zooming, lightweight digital camera!
Reviews.Author: Bruce W. Fritch
Reviews.Content: It is hard to top this new model from Nikon. 30x optical zoom, with wifi and such! Great lens and form factor. (Caution: be sure to close the little doors (e.g., to battery, to HDMI port, to USB port), or loose them. Just saying'.) This is a great, pocketable camera!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: dog
Reviews.Content: The camera is just what I wanted I had a little trouble setting up the W-FI but got a hold of Nikon and the talked me through it

Reviews.Title: quick processor
Reviews.Author: Robert Keinath
Reviews.Content: Camera has a much faster focus than the S9300 and pictures taken from a moving vehicle are in focus making a sharp picture

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Sue E
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. I was looking for a camera with a good image stabilizer and this one works great. No more fuzzy pictures! The menu is easy to navigate and the camera is lightweight. I love the fact that it has the 30X zoom on it also. The only downside is where the popup flash is located, but once you get used to holding the camera a little differently, it's no longer an issue. I love the camera!

Reviews.Title: Great "pocket" Camera
Reviews.Author: Barrett Parker
Reviews.Content: Great camera. I have had their last two models and appreciate the increased megapixels and the longer lens, but especially that I can still use the same battery as my other two Coolpix cameras

Reviews.Title: The good and what could be improved
Reviews.Author: Fred Faude
Reviews.Content: The zoom lens is great.  Photo and video quality also very good.  Easy to use.  Camera meets my expectations.Downsides are:  pop up flash is not a robust design.  Flash often shoots when I don't want it.  Fill in flash is not an obvious shoting mode.  Location of video record button is poor in that one often starts a video simply holding the camera.

Reviews.Title: Super sensitive
Reviews.Author: Peggy Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give this a 5 star rating, but it is so sensitive at the zoom that it only gets a 4 from me. Maybe it's just me, but when the zoom is out very far, it's so sensitive it's hard to get it focused and keep it on the subject. Other than that, I love it.

Reviews.Title: What a Disappointment
Reviews.Author: darby
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this camera after waiting (& waiting) for it to be in stock. The main feature I was interested in was the wi-fi capability. Well .... that has never worked ....  not even once. Nikon advertised that my iphone/ipad would be my favorite accessory.... not the case .... Also the camera is not capable of taking pictures in low light.... I'm very disappointed.....

Reviews.Title: Perfect little camera
Reviews.Author: LTCOL Alexander W
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is very quick and simple to use.  I took it on a trip and it preformed flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: Big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Steve Hoffacker
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera and immediately returned it. This camera ended a personal 47-year history of continuous Nikon ownership and use. Likely will not have another Nikon. Have moved on. Poor picture quality, focus, and other issues.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S9700 MP Wi Fi Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Miss Priss
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, I have several Nikon cameras because I love cameras. I am going to call customer support and get a few pointers on the Wi Fi connect! The camera takes great pictures, love the color

ProductInfo.Features:
Zoom up to 30x with optical zoom and 60x with Dynamic Fine Zoom
Built-in Wi-Fi for instant photo sharing
Built-in GPS, mapping, Electronic Compass and Points of Interest (POI)
Full HD 1080p videos with stereo sound for dazzling movies
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon COOLPIX S9700 16.0 MP Wi-Fi Digital Camera with 30x Zoom NIKKOR Lens, GPS, and Full HD 1080p Video (Red)
